title.narrative: Mitigating projected flood-related impacts in Unity State through targeted early action interventions in WASH and nutrition

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide early action assistance in the nutrition and water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) sectors to mitigate the compounding effects of projected severe flooding on vulnerable communities in Unity State. This UNICEF project prevents and treats acute malnutrition in children under 5 years old, sets up flood-resilient latrines to promote safe hygiene practices, and distributes essential hygiene supplies to vulnerable people, among other activities. The project provides WASH sector assistance to 66,131 people, including 14,550 men, 15,871 women, 18,516 boys, 17,194 girls and 3,308 people with disabilities, and nutrition support to 5,000 people, including 2548 boys, girls 2652 and 38 children with disabilities.
